page.title: 19FORFAR ROAD IMPROVEMENT
page.content: The{A929 ROAD}from Dundee to Forfar and Aberdeen has been upgraded and work is in progress to form dual- carriageway. The work is being funded by the Scottish Development Department. This means that the coastal route A92 to Aberdeen via Montrose, unsuitable for heavy traffic because of old narrow bridges, will be detrunked and become the responsibility of Grampian and Tayside Regions. Work on the new road is almost complete in the surveyed block. Few local people are complaining about the disruption but some farmers have lost land and one petrol station is no longer on the road and the owner is considering changing his line of business. Elderly people complain that they will have difficulty crossing to bus stops. There is a roads depot at {INVERALDIE}for winter equipment.
